summary.p: The letter carriers will report on that woman in Metz whose tongue was cut out, on the two women in Leuven who were buried alive, and on the two men who were beheaded there, as well as on the numerous exiles.

div.p: Greetings. They will speak of the most Christian woman in Metz, whose tongue was cut out by order of the imperial envoy, of the two women in Leuven who were buried alive, of the two men who were beheaded there, and of the multitude of exiles who deliver these reports.
Basel, 8th of November, in the year 1543.
To the most learned D. Heinrich Bullinger, his most esteemed brother in the Lord. Zurich.
